actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-869, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 12. All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read when called up for consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 201.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 263 - 134 (Roll no. 397).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report on the bill (S. 12) to amend title VI of the Communications Act of 1934 to ensure carriage on cable television of local news and other programming and to restore the right of local regulatory authorities to regulate cable television rates, and for other purposes, and against consideration of such conference report.

summary.text: Waives all points of order against the consideration of the conference report on S. 12 (cable television).

titles.title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report on the bill (S. 12) to amend title VI of the Communications Act of 1934 to ensure carriage on cable television of local news and other programming and to restore the right of local regulatory authorities to regulate cable television rates, and for other purposes, and against consideration of such conference report.
